title: (x) Virgin Mobile Font - Ziggurat Italic {Mark S}
content: This is the font used by Virgin Mobile throughout their packaging & identity. Any ideas on what this could be? I thought it might be Clarendon bold italic, but some characters don't match. Thanks for your help!! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131009033347im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/40981.jpg)
author: anonymous

comments.content: That would be Hoefler's [Ziggurat Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131009033347/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/ziggurat/testdriver/italic.html), I believe.
I believe you believe correctly Mark. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131009033347im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

I don't know what this typeface is, but Virgin Mobile has some connection with _Look-Look_ magazine, I think. Although it's a different typeface, their logotype features the same kind of giant slab faux 1960s faux 1890s L:   
 [http://www.look-lookmagazine.com/llmag/frames\_toc.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131009033347/http:/www.look-lookmagazine.com/llmag/frames_toc.html)   
Is this some kind of trend?
